description: Continuation of structural notes with full nailing schedule table (30+ connection types), mechanical and adhesive anchor specifications (Hilti HIT-HY 200), and structural wood requirements including lumber grades, pressure treatment, galvanization, and engineered wood product specs (Parallam PSL, Microllam LVL).
key_content: Nailing schedule: 30+ connections specified (e.g., joist to sill 3-8d, top plate to stud 2-16d end nail, double top plates 16d @ 16" O.C.)
Top or sole plate to stud: 2-16d end nail
Stud to sole plate: 4-8d toe nail or 2-16d end nail
Double top plates face nail: 16d @ 16" O.C.
Rim joist to top plate: 8d @ 6" O.C.
Built-up corner studs: 16d @ 24" O.C.
Rafter to joist face nail: 3-16d
Adhesive anchors: Hilti HIT-HY 200, ASTM A-32 threaded rods, ASTM A-563 Grade A nuts
Adhesive dowels: ASTM A-615 Grade 60
Anchor proof testing: 10% of all anchors, no sooner than 24 hours after installation
Adhesive anchors: minimum 7-day concrete cure before installation
Lumber: Douglas Fir-Larch (DFL), No. 2 grade (2x6 & under), No. 1 all others
Beams and stringers: Select Structural grade
Posts and timbers: Select Structural (4x4 and larger)
Studs: 2x4 minimum at 16" O.C. max
Pressure-treated: all wood in contact with concrete/masonry, within 6" of earth, sill plates â€” KDAT per AWPA
Hardware galvanization: minimum G-185 or stainless steel for PT lumber contact (ASTM A153)
Engineered wood: Parallam PSL (Weyerhaeuser, ICC-ESR 1387, LARR 25202)
Engineered wood: Microllam LVL (Weyerhaeuser, Grade 1.55E, ESR 1387, LARR 25202)
Wood moisture content at installation: max 19%
NOT SHOWN: specific sheathing nailing schedule for shearwalls (see shearwall schedule on detail sheet)

drawing_zones.content: Nailing Schedule table (30+ connection types with nail sizes and patterns) and Toe Nail Installation detail
Mechanical and Adhesive Anchors specifications (12 items: Hilti HIT-HY 200, testing, installation requirements)
Structural Wood specifications (lumber grades, pressure treatment, galvanization, engineered wood products, substitution requirements)
